meanings.definition: Represented in written or printed form.
meanings.sent1: The textualized document was easy to read and understand.
meanings.sent2: The book had a textualized cover with the title and author's name.
meanings.sent3: The textualized report was so clear that even a child could follow along.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a textualized map, neatly organized and easy to follow.
meanings.sent5: The textualized instructions made it simple to assemble the furniture.

meanings.sent1: She textualized her notes to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent2: The speech was textualized for publication in the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: He textualized his thoughts into a beautiful poem.
meanings.sent4: The artist textualized his emotions into a captivating story.
meanings.sent5: They textualized the ancient manuscript for modern readers to enjoy.

meanings.definition: Interpreted or analyzed as a text.
meanings.sent1: The professor textualized the ancient script to uncover its meaning.
meanings.sent2: The data was textualized to reveal hidden patterns.
meanings.sent3: She textualized the cryptic message and found it was a recipe.
meanings.sent4: The detective textualized the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: He textualized the poem, revealing layers of symbolism and depth.
